messages.message: Thanks kunal for that fix! The folder missing error msg went away and now I see this
is this just on local still? what about dogfood?
@Nidhi Did we move provisioner over to use grpc file-service yet?
@Heymian - I think provisioner is still using the old thrift-file-service. We only enabled the new file service for dogfood.
oh what is new file service?
and is the error above look like it’s from new file service?
Can you share the logs from file-service?

Hey @lydia! - the new file service is the grpc streaming based file service written in golang - here is the full design doc https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CS/pages/871596033/File-service+Redesign
Currently it is enabled in dogfood and only requests from api-server are being routed to it. We will point more clients to it in the coming weeks.  For this phase of the rollout, only read/write/stat/mkdir operations are being sent to the new file service.
The error log above does not look like it is from the new file service. Errors from the new file service start with “[File Service v2 Enabled]”
is the GRPC File service what we should use locally too?
Hey @Travis - no not yet. Currently, local environments are still configured to use the old thrift file service.  We will send out a note when we enable the grpc file service for local environments.
